hints.label: prop-adaptive-source
hints.title: Adaptive Force Source Term
hints.content:
138: :label: prop-adaptive-source
139: 
140: The adaptive force contributes a source term to the energy-momentum conservation law:
141: 
142: $$
143: J^\nu_{\text{adapt}} = \varepsilon_F \int \left[\frac{\partial V_{\text{fit}}}{\partial \rho} \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} \right] v^\nu \mu_t \, dv
144: $$
145: 
146: This accounts for the fact that the fitness landscape $V_{\text{fit}}[\rho_t]$ is evolving as the density changes.
147: 
148: **Magnitude**: Since $V_{\text{fit}}$ depends on $\rho$ through the localized integral $\int K_\rho(x, x') \Psi(x') \rho(x') dx'$:
149: 
150: $$
151: \left|\frac{\partial V_{\text{fit}}}{\partial \rho}\right| \sim \|\Psi\|_{\infty}
152: $$
153: 
154: Therefore:
155: 
156: $$
157: |J^\nu_{\text{adapt}}| \leq C_{\text{adapt}} \varepsilon_F \left\|\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t}\right\| = O(\varepsilon_F)
158: $$
159:
hints.raw_directive:
135: The adaptive force creates a **non-conservative** contribution to the energy-momentum tensor because $V_{\text{fit}}[\rho]$ depends on the walker distribution $\rho_t(x)$, which evolves in time.
136: 
137: :::{prf:proposition} Adaptive Force Source Term
138: :label: prop-adaptive-source
139: 
140: The adaptive force contributes a source term to the energy-momentum conservation law:
141: 
142: $$
143: J^\nu_{\text{adapt}} = \varepsilon_F \int \left[\frac{\partial V_{\text{fit}}}{\partial \rho} \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} \right] v^\nu \mu_t \, dv
144: $$
145: 
146: This accounts for the fact that the fitness landscape $V_{\text{fit}}[\rho_t]$ is evolving as the density changes.
147: 
148: **Magnitude**: Since $V_{\text{fit}}$ depends on $\rho$ through the localized integral $\int K_\rho(x, x') \Psi(x') \rho(x') dx'$:
149: 
150: $$
151: \left|\frac{\partial V_{\text{fit}}}{\partial \rho}\right| \sim \|\Psi\|_{\infty}
152: $$
153: 
154: Therefore:
155: 
156: $$
157: |J^\nu_{\text{adapt}}| \leq C_{\text{adapt}} \varepsilon_F \left\|\frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t}\right\| = O(\varepsilon_F)
158: $$
159: 
160: At QSD, $\partial \rho / \partial t \to 0$, so $J^\nu_{\text{adapt}} \to 0$.
